distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for pidgin fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-26491: Fixed MITM vulnerability when DNSSEC wasn't used (bsc#1199025).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: An issue was discovered in Pidgin before 2.14.9. A remote attacker who can spoof DNS responses can redirect a client connection to a malicious server. The client will perform TLS certificate verification of the malicious domain name instead of the original XMPP service domain, allowing the attacker to take over control over the XMPP connection and to obtain user credentials and all communication content. This is similar to CVE-2022-24968.
notes.title: CVE description
